name: venafi
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing venafi cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`venafi` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Venafi/terraform-provider-venafi).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing venafi cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Venafi/terraform-provider-venafi)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-venafi` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-venafi/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-venafi` repo](https://github.com/Venafi/terraform-provider-venafi/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Venafi/terraform-provider-venafi)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-venafi` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-venafi/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-venafi` repo](https://github.com/Venafi/terraform-provider-venafi/issues).

accessToken.description: Access token for Venafi TLSPDC, user should use this for authentication

apiKey.description: API key for Venafi Control Plane. Example: 142231b7-cvb0-412e-886b-6aeght0bc93d

clientId.description: application that will be using the token

devMode.description:
When set to true, the resulting certificate will be issued by an ephemeral, no trust CA rather than enrolling using
Venafi as a Service or Trust Protection Platform. Useful for development and testing.

externalJwt.description: JWT of the identity provider associated to the Venafi Control Plane service account that is granting the access token

p12CertFilename.description:
Filename of PKCS#12 keystore containing a client certificate, private key, and chain certificates to authenticate to
TLSPDC

p12CertPassword.description: Password for the PKCS#12 keystore declared in p12_cert

tokenUrl.description: Endpoint URL to request new Venafi Control Plane access tokens

tppPassword.description: Password for WebSDK user. Example: password

tppUsername.description: WebSDK user for Venafi TLSPDC. Example: admin

trustBundle.description:
Use to specify a PEM-formatted file that contains certificates to be trust anchors for all communications with the
Venafi Web Service. Example: trust_bundle = "${file("chain.pem")}"

url.description: The Venafi Platform URL. Example: https://tpp.venafi.example/vedsdk

zone.description:
DN of the Venafi TLSPDC policy folder or name of the Venafi as a Service application plus issuing template alias.
Example for Platform: testPolicy\\vault Example for Venafi as a Service: myApp\\Default

provider.description:
The provider type for the venafi package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

accessToken.description: Access token for Venafi TLSPDC, user should use this for authentication

apiKey.description: API key for Venafi Control Plane. Example: 142231b7-cvb0-412e-886b-6aeght0bc93d

clientId.description: application that will be using the token

devMode.description:
When set to true, the resulting certificate will be issued by an ephemeral, no trust CA rather than enrolling using
Venafi as a Service or Trust Protection Platform. Useful for development and testing.

externalJwt.description: JWT of the identity provider associated to the Venafi Control Plane service account that is granting the access token

p12CertFilename.description:
Filename of PKCS#12 keystore containing a client certificate, private key, and chain certificates to authenticate to
TLSPDC

p12CertPassword.description: Password for the PKCS#12 keystore declared in p12_cert

skipRetirement.description: When true, certificates will not be retired on Venafi platforms when terraform destroy is run. Default is false.

tokenUrl.description: Endpoint URL to request new Venafi Control Plane access tokens

tppPassword.description: Password for WebSDK user. Example: password

tppUsername.description: WebSDK user for Venafi TLSPDC. Example: admin

trustBundle.description:
Use to specify a PEM-formatted file that contains certificates to be trust anchors for all communications with the
Venafi Web Service. Example: trust_bundle = "${file("chain.pem")}"

url.description: The Venafi Platform URL. Example: https://tpp.venafi.example/vedsdk

Example for Platform: testPolicy\\vault Example for Venafi as a Service: myApp\\Default

tppPassword.description: Password for WebSDK user. Example: password

algorithm.description: Key encryption algorithm, either RSA or ECDSA. Defaults to `RSA`.

certificate.description: The X509 certificate in PEM format.

chain.description: The trust chain of X509 certificate authority certificates in PEM format concatenated together.

commonName.description: The common name of the certificate.

csrOrigin.description:
Whether key-pair generation will be `local` or `service` generated. Default is 
`local`.

customFields.description: Collection of Custom Field name-value pairs to assign to the certificate.

ecdsaCurve.description: ECDSA curve to use when generating a key

expirationWindow.description:
Number of hours before certificate expiry to request a new certificate. 
Defaults to `168`.

issuerHint.description:
Used with `valid_days` to indicate the target issuer when using Trust Protection 
Platform. Relevant values are: `DigiCert`, `Entrust`, and `Microsoft`.

keyPassword.description: The password used to encrypt the private key.

nickname.description:
Use to specify a name for the new certificate object that will be created and placed 
in a policy. Only valid for Trust Protection Platform.

pkcs12.description:
A base64-encoded PKCS#12 keystore secured by the `key_password`. Useful when working with resources like 
azure key_vault_certificate.

privateKeyPem.description: The private key in PEM format.

rsaBits.description:
Number of bits to use when generating an RSA key. Applies when algorithm is `RSA`. 
Defaults to `2048`.

sanDns.description: List of DNS names to use as alternative subjects of the certificate.

sanEmails.description: List of email addresses to use as alternative subjects of the certificate.

sanIps.description: List of IP addresses to use as alternative subjects of the certificate.

sanUris.description:
List of Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) to use as alternative subjects of 
the certificate.

validDays.description: Desired number of days for which the new certificate will be valid.

Whether key-pair generation will be `local` or `service` generated. Default is 
`local`.

in a policy. Only valid for Trust Protection Platform.

List of Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) to use as alternative subjects of 
the certificate.

validDays.description: Desired number of days for which the new certificate will be valid.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Certificate resources.

policySpecification.description:
The JSON-formatted certificate policy specification as documented 
[here](https://github.com/Venafi/vcert/blob/master/README-POLICY-SPEC.md). Typically read from a file using the `file`
function.

zone.description:
The *Trust Protection Plaform* policy folder or *Venafi Control Plane* application and 
issuing template.

policySpecification.description:
The JSON-formatted certificate policy specification as documented 
[here](https://github.com/Venafi/vcert/blob/master/README-POLICY-SPEC.md). Typically read from a file using the `file`
function.

zone.description:
The *Trust Protection Plaform* policy folder or *Venafi Control Plane* application and 
issuing template.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Policy resources.

policySpecification.description:
The JSON-formatted certificate policy specification as documented 
[here](https://github.com/Venafi/vcert/blob/master/README-POLICY-SPEC.md). Typically read from a file using the `file`
function.

zone.description:
The *Trust Protection Plaform* policy folder or *Venafi Control Plane* application and 
issuing template.

certificateType.description: Indicates whether the SSH certificate is for client or server authentication.

destinationAddresses.description:
A list of one or more valid IP or CIDR destination hosts where the 
certificate will authenticate.

extensions.description:
A list of key-value pairs that contain certificate extensions from the CA 
template for client certificates. Allowed values (case-sensitive): `permit-X11-forwarding`, `permit-agent-forwarding`,
`permit-port-forwarding`, `permit-pty`, `permit-user-rc`.

folder.description: The DN of the policy folder where the SSH certificate object will be created.

forceCommand.description: A command to run after successful login.

keyId.description: The identifier of the requested SSH certificate.

keyPassphrase.description: Passphrase for encrypting the private key.

keySize.description: Number of bits to use when creating a key pair. (e.g. `3072`).

objectName.description:
The friendly name of the SSH certificate object. When not specified the `key_id` 
is used for the friendly name. If the object already exists the old certificate is archived and the CA issues a new
certificate.

principal.description:
[DEPRECATED] - (Optional, set of strings) Use "principals" instead. A list of usernames for whom the 
requested certificate will be valid.
principal.deprecationMessage: This will be removed in the future. Use "principals" instead

principals.description: A list of usernames for whom the requested certificate will be valid.

privateKey.description: The private key for the SSH certificate if generated by Venafi.

publicKey.description: The OpenSSH formatted public key that will be used to generate the SSH certificate.

publicKeyFingerprint.description: The SHA256 fingerprint of the SSH certificate's public key.

publicKeyMethod.description:
Specifies whether the public key will be `local` (default), `file` or 
`service` generated.

serial.description: The serial number of the SSH certificate.

signingCa.description: The SHA256 fingerprint of the CA that signed the SSH certificate.

sourceAddresses.description:
A list of one or more valid IP or CIDR addresses that can use the SSH 
certificate.

validFrom.description: The date the SSH certificate was issued.

validHours.description: Desired number of hours for which the certificate will be valid.

validTo.description: The date the SSH certificate will expire.

windows.description: Specifies whether the private key will use Windows/DOS style line breaks.

destinationAddresses.description:
A list of one or more valid IP or CIDR destination hosts where the 
certificate will authenticate.

extensions.description:
A list of key-value pairs that contain certificate extensions from the CA 
template for client certificates. Allowed values (case-sensitive): `permit-X11-forwarding`, `permit-agent-forwarding`,
`permit-port-forwarding`, `permit-pty`, `permit-user-rc`.
